clinical_study.official_title: Routine Versus on Demand Administration of Fentanyl in Colonoscopy: A Multi-centre Randomized Controlled Trial

oversight_info.authority: Norway: South-Eastern Norway Regional Health Authority

brief_summary.textblock: Colonoscopy may be an unpleasant procedure. Sedation and/or analgesics is therefore routinely administered in most countries. In Norway, however, routine sedation is rare, and medication is normally given on demand, that is, if necessary during the procedure. The investigators want to evaluate whether the effect of fentanyl, a synthetic opioid with fast onset of action, is better given before the procedure than during the procedure.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately after the procedure and after 24 hours
primary_outcome.description: Pain is recorded on a 4 point Likert scale and a 100 mm VAS scale.

secondary_outcome.description: The investigators want to assess the need for additional medication during the colonoscopy in the "routine fentanyl-arm" compared to the "fentanyl on-demand arm".

other_outcome.description: Patients are asked about satisfaction with information and treatment (yes/no)
The number of complete procedures divided by the total number of procedures

other_outcome.time_frame: Within one hour after the procedure
other_outcome.description: The patient is asked whether he/she would be willing to have the procedure again in the same way (yes/no).

other_outcome.time_frame: Immediately after the procedure Within one hour after the procedure
other_outcome.description: Time elapsing between end of procedure until leaving the department

arm_group.description: Fentanyl is given routinely to all patients before the procedure
Fentanyl is given during the procedure if the patient experiences pain

intervention.description: 50 micrograms of fentanyl given before the procedure
Fentanyl 50 microgram is provided on-demand, that is, if the patient has pain during the procedure.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age 18-75
- Referred for out-patient colonoscopy
Exclusion Criteria:
- ASA-score 3 or higher
- Same day upper endoscopy
- Pregnancy
- Pacemaker
- Patient require medication before colonoscopy
- Previous resection of colon or rectum
- Significant psychiatric morbidity
- Oxygen saturation < 95% without supplementary oxygen
- Contra indications to fentanyl
- Inability to sign inform consent
- Inability to understand information about the trial
